29.08.text:
Hello. There's a place in the
second round

31.60.text: for whichever team can make the most

33.16.text:
of the questions we are about
to throw at them.

if tonight's losers

themselves there.

40.80.text:
Clare College Cambridge is
the second oldest in the city.

44.80.text:
It was founded as
University Hall in 1326

47.84.text:
and renamed Clare Hall
a few years later,

50.44.text:
after an endowment from Edward I's
granddaughter,

54.96.text:
one of the richest heiresses
in England.

57.28.text: It took its present name in 1856.

60.00.text:

the Old Court

62.76.text:
and the much photographed
Clare Bridge,

67.48.text:
one of which famously
has a wedge missing,

70.56.text:
about which there
are many fanciful legends,

72.88.text:
although perhaps the likeliest
explanation is that it just fell off.

77.12.text:
Alumni include the ill-fated cleric
Hugh Latimer,

79.40.text:
the poet Siegfried Sassoon
and Sir David Attenborough.

82.24.text: The college has a bronze bust of him,

84.08.text:
which students rub for luck
before their exams.

86.96.text:
Tonight's team have
an average age of 22

89.48.text:
and described themselves
as "united in their diversity",

93.20.text:
being a soldier, an actor,
a philologist and a sci-fi geek.

introductions.

Hi, I'm David Tremain,

and I'm reading for a PhD in

with industry and business.

Stephen Merchant,

146.16.text:
and the writers Anne Fine

for their appearance -

"It is better to have
buzzed and lost,

153.96.text: "than never to have buzzed at all."

155.52.text:

the next half hour.
